conclusion: To determine the pressure at 600 K, analyze the p-T graph and use V-T graph if necessary.
The p-T graph shows a linear relationship between pressure and temperature.
Identify two points on the p-T graph: (200 K, 0.5 x 10^5 Pa) and (400 K, 1.0 x 10^5 Pa).
Determine the equation of the line: p = mT + c.
Using point-slope form, derive p = 2500T - 0.5 x 10^5.
Substitute T = 600 K to find p = 1.45 x 10^5 Pa.
The pressure of the gas at 600 K is 1.45 x 10^5 Pa.
